intro: Haplolobus megacarpus, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces large, edible fruits that can weigh up to 20 kilograms, making it one of the heaviest fruits in the world. Its leaves are broad and palmate, and the plant can grow up to 10 meters in height. The botanical interest in Haplolobus megacarpus lies in its unique morphology and potential for agricultural and medicinal use.
